headline: Hearty Minestrone Soup
description: This tasty minestrone soup recipe is a hearty combination of fresh veggies, cabbage, potatoes, beans, and macaroni pasta, topped with Parmesan cheese.
name: Hearty Minestrone Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Melt margarine in a heavy stockpot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery; sauté until beginning to soften, 3 to 4 minutes. Add broth, beans, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, parsley, tomato paste, garlic, and salt; bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 1 hour. Add pasta and simmer for 30 minutes more. Adjust seasoning as needed.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with Parmesan cheese.

review.reviewBody: This was great. My family loved it.
Very simple and delicious! I added homemade Italian seasoning, and substituted beans for what I had on hand, and spinach for the cabbage and it turned out great! Will use this recipe again.

The recipe needs some pepper. I added 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. The soup does not need to be simmered as long if you like your vegetables firm. Simmer for ten minutes after you add the pasta and carrots.
Absolutely love this recipe! One of my very favorites. Have made this over a dozen times.
Loved it, I added Italian sausage which made this over the top. Plus a few of my little extras. My new “go to” soup, easy and quick!

Excellent recipe! The only deviations I made were 1) I probably doubled the garlic because we are huge garlic fans; and 2) I cooked the pasta noodles separately in heavily salted water and added it to the soup after one hour of simmering. The whole family adored the flavor and we are adding this to our usual “repertoire” of soups.
Delicious! Made as directed and it turned out so good!
In my photo the pasta isn’t added yet because the soup is still simmering, but the sauce taste deliciously yummy!!

I make this every week. I add whatever I have in the pantry (sometimes kidney beans, canned vs fresh carrots. Whatever. It's my Go-To dish each week, as I'm trying to lose weight (and succeeding!). This soup is very low fat, low calories, as well as tasty and satisfying. ???

I doubled the recipe and used Ditalini pasta instead. I do not add pasta directly to the soup, as it will absorb too much broth. Instead, I add it to individual bowls first and pour soup on top. I also add a bit of chopped spinach, extra garlic and herbs and an extra can of tomato sauce. Delicious!

Loved it, did make some minor changes. I could not do cabbage as it brings back bad memories from being on The Cabbage Soup Diet back in the 80's. LOL Instead I used zucchini. I also didn't do potatoes as I didn't want two starches in the soup. I also sautéed the garlic with the onions, celery, and carrots (versus adding it later). I also sautéed some pancetta (4 ounces) with all of the above ingredients. Yum Yum

I made this mostly according to the directions, but added green beans I had on hand, and fresh thyme from our garden, and omitted the cabbage. I also used fresh tomatoes rather than the canned tomatoes, and home-made chicken bone broth. None of these changes change the recipe substantially though. 
The one change that's important for me is boiling the pasta separately. I'm cooking for only two (my wife and me) and there are ALWAYS leftovers. If there is pasta in the leftover soup, over time it absorbs the liquid and becomes a squishy mess. So I cook the pasta separately, very al dente, and add a little to each bowl before serving.
In any case my two customers both loved it.
Everyone loved this! Easy and satisfying.

I really liked this recipe. I made it as is and despite that I halved the recipe, I decided to use up the leftover canned beans and tomatoes. I had fresh basil which I also added at the end and added about 1/4 tsp of dried oregano. I also had fresh italian parsley which I also added. It came out very good after rectifying the salt and pepper. Will make it again!!!

Used a mix of beef and chicken broth because that’s what I had (4c) then added 2c of water. Used crushed tomatoes instead of stewed along with 8oz of tomato sauce and small can of paste. Used Italian seasonings and threw in some crushed red pepper. Delicious
Stayed true to the recipe as written. Everyone in family loved it. Will definitely make again.

I used to despise Minestrone soup. The canned variety was disappointing, restaurant appetizer was usually bland. But I decided to give this a try as I'm currently on quarantine lockdown and I happened to have the ingredients. And let me tell you, this soup was amazing, simple, and delicious. I even used some inferior bouillon, and it still turned out amazing. I plan on making it again soon.
I added 1/2 red bell pepper chopped, a small zucchini and small yellow squash, both sliced and a handful of barley. I skipped the cabbage and replaced the stewed with diced tomatoes. No leftovers!!!
This was the easiest and most delicious soup I've ever made!! Litter took me 30 mins to chop and throw everything into a pot and another 30 to sautée and simmer!
Very easy to make and wonderful broth flavor.
Super simple and yum!! I added more veggies and swapped parley for basil and oregano. Delish! Just what you need for a cool night light dinner!!
I added way more of the veggies and garlic because it's too bland otherwise. But, good basic recipe

Wow. This recipe I loosely followed to use up all my veggies in the fridge and some frozen (thawed). Then used leftover chicken that was grilled, a quart of canned tomatoes, leftover homemade spaghetti sauce in place of the tomato paste, but left the noodles out. May add some tomorrow to leftovers to make it stretch but I’m undecided. With how I made it it relied heavily on the veggies seasoning it. It was made into a clean eating very healthy meal. Even my diabetic boyfriend can eat what he wants with no worries (hence me not wanting to add noodles tonight). I will use this recipe over and over. Thank you so much. Full happy bellies all around.

I put too much pasta in...even after cooking It separately....stick to the half cup.
Very tasty...will make it again
Bursting with flavor. Just the perfect minestrone.
It was easy and great. I cooked the pasta and potatoes separate so they didn’t suck up all the broth.
This is a keeper. The whole family put dibs on leftovers! I added a few ingredients; Shredded Fresh Baby Spinach, Garbanzo Beans, Red Kidney Beans, and Red Pepper Flakes.

When you want to clean out your fridge this is the soup to make, it’s hearty and tasty and makes a lot. I stuck to the instructions and added four carrots, four celery stalks, one large onion sautéed in olive oil. Made a hot spot and threw down the tomato paste to enhance the flavor and let it cook a minute before adding the rest of the veggies - in my fridge I had a piece of yellow squash, a quarter of a small cabbage and three small russet potatoes and a red bell pepper so they got cubed up and thrown in. I added a big can of plum tomatoes in purée (chopped up) and two boxes of chicken broth. For the beans I added a can of Goya Red Kidney beans in sauce which adds a lot of flavor base to the soup. Seasoning-wise I used fresh parsley, red pepper flakes, dried basil, oregano , a little garlic powder even tho I had already added minced garlic earlier, and two spoonfuls of beef bouillon in place of the salt. Cooked small soup shells separately since the last time I made this soup the shells really absorbed the broth and made it more stew like.
Made Melissa d’Arabian’s foolproof popovers with some sweet butter to go with the soup. Perfect meal for a dreary day in the Northeast and it made the house smell wonderfully of comfort food. Tomorrow it will be even better.
Absolutely delicious!! followed the recipe 100%.

I thought this was a great recipe. I made this minus the pasta and put it in the crock pot on low for 7 hours instead of cooking it on the stove. Then I just cooked the pasta separately and mixed it in before serving. I'm sure cooking the noodles in the broth itself would have been better, but I work 10 hour days, so I live by my crockpot. I will be making this again

Delicious! I made substitutions but kept proportions. Used garden fresh green beans 3/4 cups, 1 heaping cup of Zucchini, Used fresh parley and oregano. No beans Used two large seeded peeled heirloom tomatoes instead of canned and 2 tablespoons of paste. Kale instead of cabbage. Added chicken broth since liquid was absorbed after refrigerated.
This is so good!!! Only problem is that we prefer more broth. Thanks!
Great recipe. Added a dash of Tabasco to give it more zip!
so yummy....every time i make it it turns out great! I replaced the pasta with barley just because and it is very good.
Added a few extra - shreded some red cabbage as well, some diced zuchinni, cup of sweetcorn, and some oregano. Plus had to put in some bacon to kick the flavour along. Yum!
This is delicious but does need more flavor. As others did- I added a jar of tomato sauce and added more broth when adding pasta. Endless possibilities and veggies!
added some basil and oregano and it was delicious!

Excellent soup which will surely be better in a day or two. I used half olive oil and half butter to saute the veggies. I skipped the potato but did add a small chopped zucchini and half a can of green beans, drained and chopped smaller. I also added about a tblsp of brown sugar to cut the tomatoes' acidity, extra tomato paste and a little Italian seasoning. I cooked the macaroni (small shells) separately and will add to bowl of soup. I did let it simmer about 45 min because I didn't want too mushy. Topped bowl of soup with a drizzle of olive oil and romano cheese that I already had opened. Thanks for this delicious recipe!
The broth was excellent. I added some zucchini that I wanted to use up. It was a nice addition.
My Husband and I Love It. it was Good.
Awesome from the first time I made it! now nearly have this one down to a science! very good soup!
I liked it well enough though next time, I'll leave out the pasta and pitatoes.

I'm sure my husband would rate it 2 stars but I'll give it 3 because it wasn't "too" bad. I liked all the vegetables but it was bland. Also, I put in the beans when the soup was almost done and after I turned off the stove burner I then put in the macaroni (small shells). I had to add more seasoning to it, I think I'll look around on here for another recipe.
The soup came out amazing
Great recipe ! Don’t forget the homemade croutons for topping
The soup was amazing! I added a bit of cayenne pepper, zucchini, and sweet potatoes to the recipe.

Best Minestrone soup we have ever eaten! I accidentally used half a box of old sprial pasta I had around instead of reading the directions that said only 1/2 cup (lol) made it the consistency of a stew but man...but was it good and much welcomed with toasted bagels on a day that was -40 outside! We loved it, in my favorites!

Easy and delicious! I used kidney beans instead and substituted the cabbage for spinach. I added 2tbsp of paste, which others recommended. I also added zucchini to the recipe and used more of the other veggies than the recipe called for. In order to balance it out I added 2 chicken bouillon cubes and 1.5c water. Will definitely make again!
I made this for 30 people and it was GREAT! I made a couple of changes...I didn't add the potatoes because I wanted it a bit lighter in carbs and I replaced the cabbage with spinach.
This is delicious. Not overly salty and just filling enough. Will definitely make again.
My guests raved about it! I used the original recipe and added 1 tsp. of oregano and 1 tsp. of basil. I let it simmer longer to enhance the flavor before adding the pasta.
This one will definitely stay in our family staple.
I love this minestrone recipe!! The ingredients are all usually on hand and it makes a delicious soup! Wonderful way to warm up on the first day of Fall!! :)

This was delicious. I didn't have any cabbage but that was okay. I put in a parmesan rind and served it with cheddar and bacon scones. os
Why does the picture have a rosemary sprig in it? There is no rosemary in the recipe lol!
I really liked it a lot.

This is my go to minestrone soup. Tried others and this has been a real hit. If my wife likes something she raves to other coworkers and may even share. They also loved it and I printed out the recipe for them. So let’s recap a simple to follow ingredients, cost is minimal ( big on saving money) most people have these items as staples to there pantry. I added to my soup was a can of red kidney beans. Also added my own dried herbs. As for adding noodles ,I cooked them separate to allow people to add as much or as little to their bowl. Add to taste oregano a pinch to start. Dried basil ( red ) or (green) I grow both. There is a difference in taste use what you like. Dried thyme a pinch. As this soup cooks down flavor is intensified so add to your personal likes. From Mr Finger Bakes

I love this soup. It is such a yummy way to eat extra vegetables!
I followed the recipe. Added a little extra seasoning to taste. I also added chopped zucchini which was really good. I followed the suggestion of another rater and added extra tomato paste to perk up the flavor. This is a keeper recipe - thank you! I make it for dinner on Sunday and pack the left overs for work week lunches. This freezes well to save for a quick meal later.
Delicious and easy recipe. Just made a Lot dunked the recipe and will be making this quite often. We're soup lovers here
It was a wonderful hearty soup
Delicious!

This is a great basic recipe. I did make a lot of changes, as I always do with soup. I eliminated the potatoes, added zucchini and Italian seasoning. I also adjusted the quantities of the other vegetables to taste.
Easy and delicious. I did use black beans because I had them, and it came out awesome. I will make it again!
This was excellent! I’m making it again and will add some ground beef.

Wow. This is a really amazing soup. I didn’t measure anything but pretty much followed the recipe to a T. I used chickpeas instead of white beans and bag leaves during the simmering. This is a very good and simple recipe. Will make again!
All around great recipe, did a few teaks added chicken stock and extra tomato paste to make it thicker. Also next time I think I'll cook the pasta separately just because it soaks up the liquid.
I followed the recipe, and it was fantastic!!
I did not make any changes--we loved this soup! Make it soon!!!

My family went CRAZY over this soup. The only changes I made were to eliminate the potato and add fresh spinach leaves, zucchini and green beans. DELICOUS! Yes, I would definitely make this soup again. I was lucky enough to bring some for lunch today.
I MADE THIS FOR MY HUSBAND HE SAID IT IS GOOD.
I just made this for Sunday dinner and it was delicious!! Only substitution was spinach instead of cabbage... this recipe is a keeper
just like the restaurant version I remember.

This recipe was okay as a reference point for making minestrone, but really it was lacking in a few ingredients. I added zuchinni and green beans, and left out the potatoes, and found I needed more broth than one quart of chicken broth (I think I used larger portions of veggies than called for.) I also added some Italian seasoning because I thought it needed more flavor.
Too much tomato sauce . Next time I will exchange it with dice tomato. Good just the same

Very good! Didn't make much changes and it turned out well :)

Needs more soup for it though, we ran out towards the end as there were too many items in the soup and the proportions were off. All in all, good!
I actually fried up some sausages and added that for my hubby. This is a wonderful soup and very warming on a cold Wisconsin weekend.

This soup is delicious however, if you like to have a soup with some broth do not add the pasta! If you add the pasta it will soak up all the broth and you will end up with something more like a stew. Still very tasty but just a very thick consistency.
It was okay, but I thought the potato, along with the macaroni, was a little odd. The soup seemed a little bland, too. Nothing special here; I won't be making it again.
Great stuff. Instead of pasta I added rice.

Easily one of the best soups I've made. So flavorful and packed with veggies. I doubled the recipe and added a chopped zucchini. Plus I used one can of white beans and one can of red kidney beans. Perfection.
Great soup. Was looking for a soup that used my garden vegetables.

Make Ministrone soup often, today I decided to try a new recipe and so happy I did. Made this exactly no changes at all. Hubby and I loved this delicious hearty soup, will definitely use this recipe again.
was quite good, but should have zucchini. i recommend making the pasta seperate and puting it in the bottom of the bowl so that it doesn't get mushy.

Simmering the soup for an hour made the cannelini beans mushy. I would add the beans later. Cooking the pasta by simmering for 30 mins made it gummy. After the veggies are cooked, bring everything to a boil, add pasta, and cook for 8 mins instead.
just made it exactly as written- doubled it- wonderful!
Made this tonight, was great. Don't be tempted to add more salt than asked for, the cheese added when serving compensates for it. Had it with the whole wheat honey bread from this site.

Although there are Minestrone Soup recipes that have been here longer, and therefore, acquired more stars, THIS is the recipe I use....I love it. I pretty much follow it to the "T", but I add corn to it and that makes it PERFECT for my taste. Minestrone has so many variations, particular to everyone's taste, but this is a very good base for whatever you want to add.

Great soup for a cold evening. I made as written, adding more garlic, omitting the potato and using black beans as I realized too late that was all I had. Husband thought it was great. Would definitely make again.
This was so good. I skipped the potatoes and pasta and added fresh mushrooms and green beans. So much flavor.
This was a very simple and delicious recipe. I thoroughly enjoyed the flavor and will definitely make this again.
Delicious and so easy.
Little red pepper and cooked it in the pressure cooker for 30 mins yummy
The only change I made was to use vegetable stock.

4 stars only because I made a few changes. I added a few other vegetables but I think that's what is great about this recipe. You can really do anything with it. 

I put green beans, arugala, and potatoes. 

I think it's all about the touch you put on it! I posted a photo of it as well :)
I love to cook and wanted to try soups this fall. This soup is hearty and delicious just like it is. But as in all recipies I will experiment next time.

What do I love about this soup? 1. Ingredients are all on-hand. 2. It's very forgiving - add more veggies if you like, or more broth if you like a thinner soup. I added kidney beans and a small zucchini. 3. YUMMO!
The broth was a bit salty, but next time I will add some water to balance it. The vegetables were cooked through and the pasta was

I thought this was okay. I followed the recipe exactly, except for not having the small amount of cabbage. I ended up having to add a cup of water. It was still rather thick for this type of soup as it cooled down. Some people may like that though. I had recently made this type of soup from another Italian recipe, and think I may have been spoiled. This didn't have quite that same fresh taste. I am sure it will be eaten, but it is just a little salty and slightly canned soup tasting, to me, for some reason.

I actually forgot to add Parmesan as garnish but will do so tomorrow! I doubled the recipe, added extra tomato paste to thicken, some black pepper and italian seasoning and boiled pasta separately, adding afterwards. It tasted great and I've got plenty left. Will definitely be holding onto this recipe!
I put in two handful of lentils instead of the chickpeas but otherwise stayed true to the recipe. It is so delicious!! Definitely a keeper.
